title: Frequency and period - pendulum - parallel springs

content.question: A simple pendulum has a length <math alttext="L sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>, as shown in the figure. Two springs, each with a spring constant <math alttext="k sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>, hang vertically and are attached in parallel to a block. The block-springs system is displaced and oscillates vertically, while the pendulum bob is displaced such that it undergoes small-angle oscillations. What block mass would result in the same oscillation period for both the pendulum and the block-springs system?
